sub_title: Product Owner and Marketing at Gibeon Net Solutions B.V.
summary:
Reynaldo Rante Allo was born in Ambon, Indonesia. Having graduated with a Bachelor in Marketing Communication from the London School of Public Relations, Jakarta, then he continued to work in a sports company, with the brand name Yonex and Mikasa, for 2 years.

Reynaldo continued his master's study in The Netherlands and obtained a Master of Arts in Media Innovation from Breda University of Applied Sciences. He volunteered at the PPI Belanda (Indonesia Student in The Netherlands Association) as the Secretary-General/Chairperson.

After obtaining his Master's degree, he works for an IT Software Consultant company, named Gibeon Net Solutions in Rijswijk, Den Haag until now. Currently, he and his team has just launched (soft launch) a new platform for the food industry. Check out the website: www.sevenbutlers.com

treasury_media.title: Seven Butlers
treasury_media.description: Seven Butlers is een sociaal bestel- en afhaal platform voor individuen en groepen. We richten ons op het helpen van werknemers om hun lunch te bestellen bij onze lokale restaurants. Tijdens deze moeilijke tijden breiden we onze diensten uit naar maaltijdbezorging, om meer lokale restaurants te ondersteunen.

education.field_of_study: Master in Media Innovation and Technology

school.name: De Haagse Hogeschool / The Hague University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description:
-Setting work priorities to the team to ensure the proper functionality of the product
-Serving and understanding the customers needs and wants but also representing team in front of customers 
-Working closely with internal and external stakeholders to create product roadmap and align strategic goals 
-Identifying user needs, collecting feature requests, creating user stories, product testing, defining backlog items and epic that will help the development teams  
-project management experience, planning and executing for product launching 
-developing a business plan including competitors analysis and benchmarking, marketing communication plan, both online and offline.
-involving in product development: creating project brief, concepting user interface and user experience, creating use cases, and maintenance.
-creating and executing Marketing and Communication plan both online (social media strategy) and offline (direct sales)  

At the moment, you can check out my current project below:
profile_positions.title: Product Owner and Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Jakarta
2008
Responsible for establishing and maintaining network as well as collaborating with sports associations to promote Yonex and Mikasa products.
Actively seeking for new opportunities to communicate Yonex and Mikasa brands to public.
Prepare proposals for events sponsorships as well making monthly reports marketing efforts. 

September 2004	: Area Coordinator, Matrix Card "Goes to Campus" Event Promotion, 
  IPB, Bogor 
Planned and executed marketing strategies for Bogor area.
Recruited sales promotion team 5 members, trained them on Matrix' product knowledge as well as on the selected strategies to be used.
Made progress and sales reports to the Project Manager.

September 2003	: "ESIA" Sales Promotion, Hilton Hotel, Jakarta
Marketed and communicated ESIA's product to the audience.
profile_positions.title: Promotion Executive

volunteer_experiences.description: Al-Wali Foundation is a non-profit organization who prepare some volunteers from The Netherlands to help villages in Indonesia. The volunteers will help some communities, in general, about education, infrastructure, and health. Before the volunteers go to Indonesia, they need to learn some basic Indonesia conversation. Therefore, me and some friends taught them since may 2016, we prepare some short program to help them understand the culture and language of Indonesia.

This student association is established since 1912. There a lot of activities in this organization such as arranging events (culture, sports day, discussion), charity, networking with the other local organizations including international student organizations and the Indonesian Embassy.

One of my biggest achievements during this volunteer experience is: I had a chance to gather Indonesian students all over Europe in sports and cultural events in May 2011.

company.name: Indonesian Student Association The Hague (PPI Den Haag)

volunteer_experiences.description:
This student organization which is called PPI is part of the other seventeen Indonesia student associations in the Netherlands. We are welcoming and helping new Indonesian students, arranging events, and being actively involved in other international students' activities.

One of my biggest achievements, when I lead this organization, is the ARIBA project. Ariba is a project that aimed to help Indonesia students sharing best practices and knowledge from each industry.
